name: Provider
notice: Fields with (*) are mandatory and must be completed in order to submit this form. Leaving optional fields blank will remove the relevant heading from the published resource/provider profile.

description.text: Full Name of the Provider/Organisation offering Resources and acting as main contact point for the Resources.
Abbreviation of the Provider Name.
The node in which the Provider belongs to.
The ID of the Catalogue this Provider is originally registered at.
Website with information about the Provider.
Is the Provider a Legal Entity?

Legal status of the Provider. The legal status is usually noted in the registration act/statutes. For independent legal entities this should be the legal status of the Provider. For embedded Providers this should be the legal status of the hosting legal entity.

A Hosting Legal Entity (HLE) is an institution registered as an EOSC resource provider, that is a legal entity and agrees to be accountable for resources onboarded to EOSC. Resources may be onboarded by a resource provider which is not a legal entity, but only if the Hosting Legal Entity field includes one legal entity already registered as resource provider, if this has been agreed in advance with them.
A high-level description of the Provider in fairly non-technical terms, with the vision, mission, objectives, background, experience.

suggestion.text: Link to the logo/visual identity of the Provider. Go to the Provider's website --> Right Click on the Provider's logo on the website --> Select 'Copy Image Link' --> Paste it in the field below.

description.text: Links to video, slideshow, photos, screenshots with details of the Provider.
Short description of the Multimedia content.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources.
A named group of Providers that offer access to the same type of Resources, within the defined domain.
Keywords associated to the Provider to simplify search by relevant keywords.

suggestion.text: Add one Tag in each entry. For multi-word keywords, please use '-' to concatenate words. Suggested length is 20 characters

description.text: Structure Type of the Provider (single-sited, distributed, mobile, virtual, etc.).
Street and Number of incorporation or Physical location of the Provider or its coordinating centre in the case of distributed, virtual, and mobile Providers.
Postal code of incorporation or physical location of the Provider or its coordinating centre in the case of distributed, virtual, and mobile Providers.
City of incorporation or physical location of the Provider or its coordinating centre in the case of distributed, virtual, and mobile Providers.
Region of incorporation or physical location of the Provider or its coordinating centre in the case of distributed, virtual, and mobile Providers.
Country of incorporation or physical location of the Provider or its coordinating centre in the case of distributed, virtual, and mobile Providers.
First Name of the Provider's main contact person/Provider manager.
Last Name of the Provider's main contact person/Provider manager.
Email of the Provider's main contact person/Provider manager.
Phone of the Provider's main contact person/Provider manager.
Position of the Provider's main contact person/Provider manager.
It is strongly recommended to include here a stable generic contact such as info@ or contact@
First Name of the Provider's contact person to be displayed publicly at the Portal.
Last Name of the Provider's contact person to be displayed publicly at the Portal.
Email of the Provider's contact person to be displayed publicly at the Portal or general email to contact the Provider.
Phone of the provider's contact person to be displayed publicly at the Portal or general phone to contact the Provider.
Position of the Provider's contact person to be displayed publicly at the Portal.
Current status of the Provider life-cycle.
List of certifications obtained for the Provider (including the certification body, the certificate number or URL if available).
Providers that are funded by several countries should list here all supporting countries (including the coordinating country first).
Providers that are members or affiliated or associated with other organisations should list those organisations here.
Providers that are members of networks should list those networks here.
(Applicable to ESFRIs only) ESFRI domain classification (Applicable to ESFRIs only).

If the research infrastructure is (part of) an ESFRI project indicate how the RI participates: a) is a node of an ESFRI project, b) is an ESFRI project, c) is an ESFRI landmark, d) is not an ESFRI project or landmark.
MERIL scientific domain classification.
MERIL scientific subdomain classification.
Basic research, Applied research or Technological development.
Provider’s participation in the Grand Societal Challenges defined by the European Commission.
Provider's participation in a national roadmap.

An administrator has full edit privileges for the provider’s information via the web and the API (add a new service, update information regarding the provider’s organization and services, activate or delete a service, add or remove administrators and issue tokens for API use).
First Name of the Provider's administrator.
Last Name of the Provider's administrator.
Email of the Provider's administrator.

suggestion.text: Use this email when you login in AAI for gaining administrator privileges for your provider.
